alert.note: Alert for Grant (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 10:24PM MDT until August 22 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Mexico... Gila River Above Gila affecting Grant County. For the Gila River...including Gila, minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Gila River Above Gila. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM MDT Saturday was 15.26 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday morning and continue falling to 6.0 feet Monday night. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.2 feet on 09/22/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 6 AM MDT.
